extendedIngredients.name: cherry tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pint pear or cherry tomatoes, halved

extendedIngredients.name: corn on the cob
extendedIngredients.originalString: 6 medium to large corn on the cob (shucked and rinsed)

extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods
extendedIngredients.name: honey
salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

recipes.title: Fresh Corn, Tomato and Zucchini Salad

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Salad. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. One wine you could try is Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 27 dollars.

productMatches.title: Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Selected from three of California's most recognized Chardonnay appellations, Sonoma, Monterey and Napa, our Ghost Pines Chardonnay offers expressive, fruit-forward characteristics. The artful combination of these three regions delivers baked apple, pear and lemon cream flavors, accented by an elegant finish of sweet vanilla.

recipes.instructions: 1.  Cut corn off the cob by placing it upright in a deep bowl and cut down the sides of the cob with a sharp knife.2.  Dice zucchini into 1/2-inch pieces (leave skin on) and add to the bowl.  Add tomatoes and basil.3.  In a separate small bowl, whisk together the vinegar, olive oil, honey and lime juice.  Pour the vinaigrette over the salad and toss to combine.  Cover the salad with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least one hour and up to 4 hours until ready to serve.  Toss again before serving to re-distribute the dressing.  Add salt and freshly ground black pepper just before serving.

steps.step: Cut corn off the cob by placing it upright in a deep bowl and cut down the sides of the cob with a sharp knife.2.  Dice zucchini into 1/2-inch pieces (leave skin on) and add to the bowl.
Add tomatoes and basil.3.  In a separate small bowl, whisk together the vinegar, olive oil, honey and lime juice.

Pour the vinaigrette over the salad and toss to combine.  Cover the salad with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least one hour and up to 4 hours until ready to serve.  Toss again before serving to re-distribute the dressing.
Add salt and freshly ground black pepper just before serving.
